content: I am a passionate agricultural economist and a Ph.D. candidate at University of California, Davis. My research interests lies in the intersection of agricultural policy and industrial organization, with a special focus on the organization of modern agricultural supply chains. I am now working under the guidance of Prof. Richard J. Sexton and Prof. Rachael E. Goodhue.
summary: I am a passionate agricultural economist and a Ph.D. candidate at University of California, Davis. My research interests lies in the intersection of agricultural policy and industrial organization, with a special focus on the organization of modern agricultural supply chains.
title: Yujing (Megan) Song

summary: Many trading relationships for agricultural products are informal or relational. Informal agreements formed by trading partners, often called Relational Contracts, are sustained by the value of future relationships. Understanding the functioning of RC is important for us to understand the organization of modern agricultural supply chains. Access to a proprietary database allows me to make one of the first empirical analyses of RC and their impacts at an intermediate stage of agricultural supply chain.
title: Chinese Wholesale Produce Markets: Testing the Theories of Relational Contracts

summary: In 2017, 38,200 acres of California strawberries generated $3.1 billion in production value, making it one of the state’s top ten crops. Strawberry production ramps up in March and is at its peak in April through June. At press time, much of this period has been impacted by COVID-19-related restrictions that have been in place nationally and internationally, making the potential impacts relatively large in terms of the share of annual production affected.
title: How is the Strawberry Industry Weathering the Pandemic?
